config.question: Alfred Thayer Mahan promoted American overseas expansion by __________.

choices.content: arguing that sea power was the key to world domination
developing a lurid “yellow press” that stimulated popular excitement
provoking naval incidents with Germany and Britain in the Pacific
arguing that the Monroe Doctrine implied American control of Latin America

answer_3.response: Mahan was the era’s most influential naval strategist. After graduating from the Naval Academy in 1859, he devoted a lifetime to studying the influence of sea power in history; for more than two decades, he headed the Newport Naval War College, where officers imbibed the latest strategic thinking. A clear, logical writer, Mahan summarized his beliefs in major books, including The Influence of Sea Power upon History, 1660–1783 (1890) and The Interest of America in Sea Power (1897).
